arts.ttl: Reading boss assesses 'very good' performance and win over in-form Peterborough
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt was full of praise for his makeshift defence in Saturday's 3-1 victory over Peterborough United. With Tyler Bindon falling ill in the build-up and Amadou Mbengue still missing, the Royals played three full-backs but were well-worth their win over Posh which lifted them into sixth. "We spoke about it before, no matter who comes in and wears the shirt they give everything," Hunt said. "If they make a mistake, it’s not for a lack of effort or a bad place, it’s a genuine mistake and they do everything to make up for it. That’s what we want. we had to change the team this morning, Tyler fell ill yesterday evening and Andre had a knock, so we had to shuffle it around. They’re in a good place mentality wise. "I planned on playing him [Yiadom] 70 today and he ended up doing the 90. He said he was okay, but we have to assess him and not get carried away. I thought both of them [Yiadom and Stickland] were fantastic in terms of attitude, endeavour and quality. On the ball and off the ball, communication was really good."

arts.ttl: Reading extend unbeaten League One run to 11 games with win over Peterborough
Reading return to the play-offs with impressive victory over in-form Peterborough
arts.sum: Reading return to the play-off places with an impressive 3-1 victory over Peterborough United, extending their unbeaten run to 11 matches and halting Posh's at eight. A thrilling spectacle for those in attendance, the Royals found the net through Sam Hughes' own goal, Mamadi Camara and Charlie Savage, while Kwame Poku converted for Darren Ferguson's side. Noel Hunt made three changes, with Tyler Bindon and Andre Garcia's absence making for a makeshift back line comprised of three full-backs and a young Michael Stickland. Always promising to be an open match displaying footballing qualities between two sides who like to play with the ball on the floor, that is exactly how it went. Reading pressed from the off and took the lead inside 10 minutes. Emmanuel Fernandez gave away possession and after some quick play around the box, Kelvin Ehibhatiomhan cut the ball into the box and Posh captain Hughes beat Chem Campbell to possession but could only turn past his own goalkeeper.

arts.ttl: Reading team news: Tyler Bindon missing as makeshift defence play free-scoring Posh
arts.sum: Reading have fielded a makeshift defence this afternoon for the visit of free-scoring Peterborough United, with Tyler Bindon missing. The New Zealand international has returned from securing a place in the World Cup but does not feature in Noel Hunt's matchday squad. Posh, unbeaten in eight, have scored more goals than the Royals and boast the 'most complete' forward line in League One, so says Hunt. Joel Pereira remains in goal behind a back four of Tivonge Rushesha, Michael Stickland, Andy Yiadom and Kelvin Abrefa.

arts.ttl: Live updates: Reading and Peterborough United put unbeaten runs on the line
arts.sum: Reading return from the international break at home to Peterborough United in a clash between two of the division's form sides. The Royals haven't lost in 10 while Posh have not tasted defeat in eight.

arts.ttl: The Reading Chronicle has covered Reading from the very start- and possibly its end
arts.sum: It is impossible to assess the impact of the Reading Chronicle during it’s 200-year history and not discuss possibly the most significant institution in the town, Reading Football Club. Founded in 1871, the Biscuitmen have remained the only professional club in the county of Berkshire since 1895, remaining out of the Football League for the first 32 years of the English Football League’s existence but being founder members of Division Three South. Attracting large crowds in the early 20th century, particularly around World War Two, it was in 1927 that the club set its record attendance as 33,042 witnessed the FA Cup victory over Brentford, a record which stands to this day as the club reached the semi-final for the first time.

arts.ttl: 'Zero evidence of conspiracy': Why Reading published their financial accounts late
arts.sum: Supporters Trust at Reading [STAR] have confirmed that the reason the club financial accounts were almost 12 months overdue is because of 'issues with the documentation needed to be provided related to the club being a going concern.' The Royals published their 2022/23 financial accounts on Tuesday, which showed a £21m pre-tax loss, but these were due to be published in March 2024. In fact, the club are supposed to publish their 2023/24 accounts before March 31. Delayed accounts saw the club placed under a transfer embargo by the EFL, causing issues when it came to replacing players in the winter transfer window.

arts.ttl: Reading supporters encouraged to back teenagers in cup final at SCL Stadium
arts.sum: Reading supporters are being encouraged to turn out in their numbers and back the Under-18s as they host West Ham United in the Under 18 Premier League Cup final. Harrison Gilkes' side have kept up the club's tradition of excellence in the youth ranks, backing up last year's Berks and Bucks Senior Cup success for the Under-21s and appearance in the PL2 play-off semi-final. The Royals topped a group with Blackburn Rovers, Sunderland and West Bromwich Albion before knocking out Merseyside pair Everton and Liverpool to book their place in the final. The Hammers will visit the Select Car Leasing Stadium on Tuesday, April 22 (7pm kick-off) and is open to supporters.

arts.ttl: Peterborough United attack 'the most complete in League One' says Reading boss
arts.sum: Reading boss Noel Hunt has heaped praise on Saturday's opponents, Peterborough United, particularly their attacking potential. Posh, managed by long-term servant Darren Ferguson, are sat in the bottom half of League One after two successive play-off finishes. Reigning champions of the EFL Trophy, they are looking to retain the title at Wembley Stadium next month in a clash with Birmingham City. However, this season failed to click and Posh struggled with relegation form until the turn of the year. But now on an eight-match unbeaten run, up against Reading's 10-match run of their own, Hunt is wary of the threat posed.

arts.ttl: Preview: Reading vs. Peterborough United - prediction, team news, lineups
arts.sum: Sports Mole previews Saturday's League One clash between Reading and Peterborough United, including predictions, team news and possible lineups.
